Immunohistochemical detection of the mammary progenitor marker cytokeratin 6 (CK6; product of the Krt6 gene)
17 localized cells with a stem/progenitor signature specifically to the tumor−stromal interface (Fig. 1j). SMO inhibition reduced the expression of Id3, Gpc3, Thy1, Sox10, and Krt6 and significantly reduced the number of cells positive for CK6 and the mitotic marker phospho-Histone H3 at the tumor−stromal interface (Fig. 1f, j). These data demonstrate that paracrine Hh signaling results in the induction of a reversible stem-like phenotype preferentially at the tumor−stromal interface.
